fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe the phenomenon of energy transfer in a chemical reaction 2013 define exothermic and endothermic reactions 2013 identify exothermic and endothermic reactions 2013 draw energy diagrams 2013 do simple calculations associated with energy transfer during a chemical reaction.
fields.title: Endothermic and Exothermic Reactions
fields.tags: energy, reaction, bond, reactions, activation, endothermic, transmittion, exothermic, endothermic and exothermic reactions, enthalpy

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 define reaction rate as the change of concentration of reactants or products with time 2013 give examples of fast and slow reactions 2013 draw a graph showing changes of concentration with time 2013 find reaction rates from given experimental data 2013 describe the basic methods for the determination of reaction rates 2013 describe the economic importance of reaction rates.
fields.title: Reaction Rate
fields.tags: product, slow, fast, reaction, catalyst, rate, reactant, kinetic, reaction rate, determination

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain what vitamins are and classify them as water-soluble or fat-soluble 2013 mention some sources of vitamins 2013 discuss methods for protecting food against the adverse effect of bacteria and oxygen 2013 explain the terms: avitaminosis, hypervitaminosis, antivitamin, functional food, antibiotics.
fields.title: Food and Drugs
fields.tags: food, body, drug, human, bacteria, vitamin, drugs, antibiotics, antioxidant, preservative, aspirin, food and drugs

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 give the definitions of carbohydrates, mono-, di- and polysaccharides 2013 describe the structures of glucose, fructose, sucrose, starch, cellulose and glycogen 2013 describe the properties of these compounds and give reactions for their identification 2013 discuss the importance of carbohydrates in the diet.
fields.title: Carbohydrates
fields.tags: energy, carbon, cellulose, glucose, carbohydrate, carbohydrates, sucrose, starch, glycogen, molecule, structural, lactose, saccharide

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe what amino acids, polypeptides and proteins are 2013 discuss the spatial structure of proteins 2013 explain the phenomenon of denaturation and name the factors that cause it 2013 describe the color reactions used for the detection of proteins.
fields.title: Proteins
fields.tags: code, complex, compound, bond, carbon, cell, protein, proteins, amino acid, gene, genetic, carboxyl

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe the structure of a fat molecule 2013 classify fats according to their physical state, origin and structure 2013 describe the reactions of saponification and the hardening of oils 2013 give the uses of fats.
fields.title: Fats
fields.tags: point, oil, fat, compound, bond, acid, metabolism, fats, glycerol, melting, saturated, lipid, unsaturated, isomer, cis, trans

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 know and understand the cracking process 2013 understand what octane rating means 2013 know the products from the complete and the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.
fields.title: Cracking and Combustion of Hydrocarbons
fields.tags: product, process, combustion, methane, octane, hydrocarbons, hydrocarbon, cracking, cracking and combustion of hydrocarbons

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 understand the role of fossil fuels 2013 know the origin of fossil fuels 2013 know the location of the main deposits of fossil fuels in the world 2013 understand the fractional distillation process.
fields.title: Fossil Fuels and Crude Oil
fields.tags: oil, fuel, natural, gas, coal, fuels, molecule, distillation, methane, organic, fossil, crude, fossil fuels and crude oil

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 define the terms: monomer, polymer, polymerization 2013 describe the structures of polymers and classify them according to the structure of macromolecules 2013 define a copolymer 2013 indicate everyday objects that are made of plastic 2013 mention the basic properties of polymers 2013 explain the terms thermoplastics and thermosetting plastics 2013 describe the uses of at least three different polymers.
fields.title: Polymers
fields.tags: polymerization, polymer, polymers, bonds, monomer, thermoplastic, thermosetting, copolymer

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 know how to identify the products from the complete combustion of hydrocarbons.- understand the origin of unwanted industry-related effects in the atmosphere 2013 know what we could do to combat the greenhouse effect, acid rains, increasing amounts of plastic litter 2013 understand the difference between total and incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.
fields.title: Environmental Impact of Oil Products
fields.tags: product, oil, rain, gas, effect, environmental, acid, greenhouse, carbon, dioxide, impact, products, recycling, polymer, environmental impact of oil products

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe the properties of nitrogen, and its uses 2013 describe the properties of ammonia and the method for its synthesis on an industrial scale 2013 describe the properties of nitric(V) acid and the steps in its preparation from ammonia 2013 give the definition of reaction yield and be able to use it in simple calculations.
fields.title: Ammonia and Nitric Acid
fields.tags: gas, compound, toxic, acid, nitrogen, formula, ammonia, nitric, corrosive, ammonia and nitric acid

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 discuss the structure of soil 2013 name the basic elements essential for plants and discuss their effect on plants 2013 give natural and artificial sources of these elements 2013 describe the processes for preparing basic artificial fertilizers containing nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium 2013 describe the effect of fertilizers on water basins or reservoirs, and ways of preventing the pollution of surface water with fertilizers.
fields.title: Fertilizers
fields.tags: plant, water, mineral, deposit, nutrition, calcium, fertilizers, fertilizer, sulfur, magnesium, organic, inorganic, composting

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 name the constituents of clean air 2013 name the pollutants of air, their sources and environmental impact 2013 explain the terms 'acid rain' and 'smog' 2013 discuss the preparation of oxygen and nitrogen from air 2013 describe the properties of oxygen and its applications.
fields.title: Air
fields.tags: water, atmosphere, air, space, earth, temperature, oxygen, carbon, dioxide, nitrogen, argon, solar, uv

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe the method for the extraction of iron in a blast furnace 2013 explain the production process for steel 2013 describe the corrosion of iron and steel 2013 describe methods for the protection of iron and steel against corrosion.
fields.title: Iron
fields.tags: iron, metal, limestone, steel, ore, extraction, coke, corrosion, slag

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 name the minerals that contain copper and titanium 2013 discuss methods for the extraction and refining of copper 2013 describe the method for the extraction of titanium 2013 explain why titanium and copper do not corrode 2013 state the uses of copper and titanium.
fields.title: Copper and Titanium
fields.tags: nugget, metal, copper, titanium, ore, patina, electrorefining, copper and titanium

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 name the ores of aluminum 2013 describe the process of extracting aluminum from bauxite 2013 using aluminum as an example, discuss the phenomenon of passivation 2013 mention the most important uses of aluminum 2013 explain how aluminum is recycled and indicate the benefits of this process.
fields.title: Aluminum
fields.tags: iron, metal, aluminum, ore, electrolysis, anode, passivation, catode

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 name the types of rock that contain calcium carbonate 2013 describe the reactions that occur in limestone in the presence of carbon dioxide and water 2013 explain what quicklime and slaked lime are and how they are prepared 2013 explain the terms mortar, cement, concrete and glass 2013 describe the methods of preparation and applications of these materials.
fields.title: Industrial Uses of Limestone
fields.tags: water, rock, limestone, uses, marble, chalk, concrete, cement, carbonate, industrial, dissolution, mortar, industrial uses of limestone

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 mention the most important chemical elements which make up the Earth's crust 2013 give the names of minerals that contain iron, aluminum, titanium and copper and write their chemical formulas 2013 predict, on the basis of the reactivity series of the metals, whether a given metal can displace another metal from its compounds 2013 discuss the methods for metal extraction from ores.
fields.title: Metals from Metal Ores
fields.tags: rock, metal, chemistry, industry, products, minerals, metals, ore, ores, metals from metal ores

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 name the principal minerals that contain sulfur 2013 discuss the properties of sulfur 2013 describe the methods for the extraction and the combustion reactions of sulfur 2013 discuss the process for manufacturing and the hygroscopic properties of sulfuric(VI) acid 2013 discuss the uses of sulfur and sulfuric(VI) acid 2013 describe the effect of sulfur dioxide on living organisms and on the process of corrosion.
fields.title: Sulfur and Sulfuric(VI) Acid
fields.tags: acid, dioxide, molecule, sulfur, properties, formulae, formula, sulfuric, pyrite, sulfuric(VI), sulfur and sulfuric(VI) acid

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain how the Earth's atmosphere evolved before reaching its present composition 2013 describe the approximate percentage composition of the atmosphere at present 2013 discuss the structure of the atmosphere 2013 describe the process of formation of radicals by the break-up of a covalent bond 2013 explain how chlorine radicals can deplete the ozone layer 2013 explain the effect of the ozone-hole expansion on human health 2013 explain how the ozone layer is formed 2013 describe the causes of the greenhouse effect, and what impact it could have on the living conditions on Earth.
fields.title: The Atmosphere
fields.tags: atmosphere, layer, ozone, radical, layers, stratosphere, the atmosphere

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 define the relative positions of the Earth, Moon and Sun in the Universe 2013 name the layers of the Earth 2013 describe the properties of the main layers within the Earth 2013 compare the abundance of elements in the Earth2019s crust and in the whole of the Earth 2013 specify the sources of information used to determine the structure of the inner part of the Earth 2013 describe how density, pressure and temperature vary with depth from the surface 2013 specify the position of the magnetic poles of the Earth.
fields.title: The Structure of the Earth
fields.tags: gold, plate, structure, mercury, earth, core, radius, tectonic, inner, mantle, crust, the structure of the earth

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 say what tectonic plates are and describe their properties 2013 explain why tectonic plates shift 2013 explain what happens in places where the edges of tectonic plates meet 2013 describe what divergent, convergent and transform boundaries are 2013 give evidence for the expansion of the ocean floor 2013 present the evidence for the changes in the Earth2019s magnetic field in the past 2013 say how continents move 2013 give the evidence for continental drift.
fields.title: Tectonic Plates
fields.tags: plate, earth, earthquake, plates, tectonic, tectonic plates, mantle, lithosphere, geology, volcanic, oceanic

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain what weathering is and list the factors that influence this process 2013 name and describe the types of rock weathering 2013 give examples of physical, chemical and biological weathering 2013 explain what erosion involves and give examples of different forms of erosion 2013 name the ways in which weathered rocks are transported 2013 discuss rock transportation by water, wind and glaciers 2013 explain the origin of sediments on sea and ocean floors.
fields.title: Sedimentary Rocks. Part I
fields.tags: water, sea, transport, part, ice, land, rock, erosion, wind, weathering, sedimentary, rocks, sedimentary rocks part I

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain how the oceans were formed 2013 explain the origin of salts in the oceans 2013 list the characteristic properties of sea water 2013 list the most abundant ions in sea water 2013 discuss the concentration of salts in oceans 2013 discuss salinity balance 2013 discuss the role of the oceans in maintaining the composition of the atmosphere 2013 discuss the economic importance of the oceans.
fields.title: Oceans
fields.tags: water, salt, sea, earth, ocean, oceans, plankton, marine, salinity, layers, phytoplankton

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain how volcanoes form 2013 explain why earthquakes occur and describe where they occur most often 2013 show the location of volcanoes on the Earth, using a map with the tectonic plates marked on it 2013 show the location of seismic zones on the Earth, using a map with the tectonic plates marked on it 2013 describe the effect of the processes involving tectonic plates on the formation of volcanoes and earthquakes 2013 describe the applications of the Richter scale.
fields.title: Tectonic Movements, Earthquakes and Volcanoes
fields.tags: earth, volcano, earthquake, movement, tectonic, lava, sensor, epicentre, earthquakes, volcanoes, eruption, movements, tectonic movements, earthquakes and volcanoes

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain what minerals are, what rocks are composed of and what is the difference between a rock and a mineral 2013 explain which chemical compounds are the principal components of magma 2013 explain how igneous rocks are formed and classify them according to the form of their crystals 2013 distinguish between intrusive and extrusive rocks 2013 give examples of the most common igneous rocks and explain the differences between them 2013 list the characteristic properties of igneous rocks 2013 know the applications of igneous rocks.
fields.title: Igneous Rocks
fields.tags: rock, earth, rocks, tectonic, sedimentary, igneous rocks, magma, igneous, metamorphic, mantle, crust, volcanic, extrusive

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain how metamorphic rocks are formed 2013 give examples of the most common metamorphic rocks 2013 mention the characteristic properties of metamorphic rocks 2013 discuss the 'rock cycle' 2013 recognize the basic types of rock on the basis of their characteristic properties.
fields.title: Metamorphic Rocks and Circulation of Rock Material
fields.tags: stone, rock, earth, material, rocks, marble, fossil, slate, quartzite, metamorphic, circulation, gneiss, metamorphic rocks and circulation of rock material

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain how sedimentary rocks were formed 2013 account for the order in which rock layers are arranged 2013 explain how fossils were formed 2013 determine the age of rock layers on the basis of the fossils found in them 2013 give examples of the most common sedimentary rocks and explain the differences between them 2013 name the characteristic properties of sedimentary rocks 2013 describe the principal component of limestone rocks.
fields.title: Sedimentary Rocks. Part II
fields.tags: part, age, rock, earth, layer, period, clay, limestone, sedimentary, fossil, sandstone, crust, rocks, epoch, sedimentary rocks part II

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 recognise the types of hazardous substance on the basis of the hazard symbols 2013 read the hazards involved in contact with a given substance and the guidelines for handling on the basis of the R and S symbols 2013 specify appropriate personal protective equipment 2013 discuss the principles for the safe conduct of experiments 2013 describe the procedure in an emergency.
fields.title: Safety in the Chemical Laboratory
fields.tags: safety, chemistry, chemical, laboratory, chemicals, safety in the chemical laboratory

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe how solids are stored 2013 give guidelines on how to correctly transfer solids from containers, and how to weigh and crush solids 2013 explain what decantation, filtration and evaporation involve and why these techniques are used 2013 discuss the structure of the Bunsen burner and its safe use.
fields.title: Handling Solids. Heating
fields.tags: solid, heating, solvent, filtration, separation, filter, handling, decantation, mortar, tarring, evaporator, solids, handling solids. heating

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain the purpose of a graduated cylinder, pipette and burette and describe how they are used 2013 describe how to transfer a liquid from a bottle to a beaker 2013 carry out a temperature measurement and determination of the pH and odour of a liquid 2013 determine the age of rock layers on the basis of the fossils found in them 2013 heat a liquid in a test-tube in a safe way.
fields.title: Handling Liquids
fields.tags: cylinder, water, test, liquid, tube, liquids, beaker, measuring, handling, burette, pipette, handling liquids

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 explain what a flame test involves, give the flame colors characteristic of lithium, sodium, potassium, barium, calcium, copper and lead, and be able to distinguish between these metals on the basis of their flame colours 2013 describe simple methods for detecting ammonium, carbonate, sulfate(VI), sulfate(IV) and halide ions.
fields.title: Testing for Ions
fields.tags: test, solution, ions, testing, hydroxide, ion, sulfate, ammonium, halide, testing for ions

fields.description: At the end of this activity, students should be able to: 2013 describe the set-up used for collecting gases 2013 prepare equipment for measuring the volume of gases evolved from various chemical reactions 2013 describe methods for obtaining oxygen, hydrogen and carbon dioxide in a chemistry lab and for the identification of these gases 2013 discuss how to use indicator paper when investigating gases.
fields.title: Gases: Handling and Laboratory Tests
fields.tags: gas, reaction, acid, carbon, dioxide, laboratory, base, indicator, handling, tests, gases,  handling and laboratory tests

fields.title: Physical Changes Accompaying Heating and Cooling
The Electron Configuration of an Atom
The Bohr Model of the Atom
The Periodic Table and Chemical Properties of the Elements
Applications of Electrolysis and Calculations Connected with Electrolysis
Metamorphic Rocks and Circulation of Rock Material

/*--- Image Viewer ---*/.Image_Viewer_Public_frame {
	cursor: pointer;
	background-color: #ffffff;
	padding: 2px;
	border: 1px solid #b0bdd2;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
	z-index: 0 !important;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-label {
	padding: 5px;
	padding-right: 5px;
	padding-left: 5px;
	margin-right: 20px;
	border: solid 1px #656565;
	background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9);
	-webkit-box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	border-radius:6px;
	color: #000000;
	font-size: 14px;
	font-family: Verdana;
	text-align: center;
	background-position: center;
	line-height: 18px;
}

/*--- animation ---*/.animationFrame {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
	padding: 2px;
	background-color: transparent;
}

.animationFrame .animation-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animationFrame .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

/*--- animation small---*/	.animationFrame-small {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
	padding: 2px;
	background-color: #ffffff;
}

.animationFrame-small .animation-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animationFrame-small .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 40px;
	width: 40px;
	margin-top: -20px !important;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

/*--- animation empty---*/			.animation_empty {
	cursor: pointer;
	background-color: transparent;
	padding: 0 !important;
	border: 0 !important;
}

.animation_empty .animation-watermark {
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animation_empty .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

.animation-label {
	padding: 5px;
	padding-right: 5px;
	padding-left: 5px;
	border: solid 1px #656565;
	background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9);
	-webkit-box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	border-radius:6px;
	color: #000000;
	font-size: 14px;
	font-family: Verdana;
	text-align: center;
	background-position: center;
}

	border-radius: 4px;
	background-image: none;
	padding: 5px;
	text-align: center;
	color: #6B6B6B;

 */ /* Old browsers */	background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
	/* FF3.6+ */	background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, color-stop(20%, #fafafa), color-stop(45%, #dcdcdc), color-stop(51%, #c8c8c8), color-stop(90%, #f0f0f0));

/*--- PUZZLE ---*/.addon_Puzzle {

}

/* TABLES */	.Table {
	border-collapse:collapse;
	color: #717171;
	border: 0;
	border-radius: 5px;
	border:1px solid #d3d3d3;
	background:#fefefe;
	-moz-border-radius:5px;
	/* FF1+ */		-webkit-border-radius:5px;
	/* Saf3-4 */	border-radius:5px;
	-moz-box-shadow: 0 0 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
	-webkit-box-shadow: 0 0 4px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
}

.Table td {
	border: 1px solid #e1e1e1 !important;
	border-left: 0 !important;
	-webkit-text-size-adjust:100% !important;
}

.Table .row_1 {
	border-top: 0 !important;
}

.Table tr:last-child td {
	border-radius: 0 0 5px 5px;
	border-bottom: 0 !important;
	border-left: 0 !important;
}

.Table tr td:last-child {
	border-radius: 0 5px 0 0;
	border-right: 0 !important;
}

/* WRITING CALCULATIONS */	.WritingCalculations {
	background-color: #fafafa;
	border: 0;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding: 40px;
}

.WritingCalculations #writing-calculations-wrapper {
	margin: auto;
}

.WritingCalculations .container-line {
	border-bottom: 1px solid darkgrey !important;
}

.WritingCalculations .wrapper-row {
	margin: 3px 0 3px 0;
	background-color: none;
}

.WritingCalculations .wrapper-cell {
	font-size: 17px;
	color: #717171;
	font-family: Verdana;
	line-height:24px;
}

.WritingCalculations .writing-calculations-input {
	border: 1px solid #B0BDD2;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding-left: 2px;
	display: block;
	font-size: 17px;
	height: 24px;
}

.WritingCalculations .correct {
	background-image: none;

/*CHOICE*/.ic_soption {
	cursor: pointer;
	line-height: 24px;
	clip:rect(0px, 52px, 26px, 0px);
	overflow: hidden;
	background: url('/file/serve/1874207');
	background-repeat: no-repeat;
	background-position: 0px 0px;
	-webkit-text-size-adjust:100% !important;
}

.ic_soption-up {
	background-position: 0px 0px;
}

.ic_soption-down {
	background-position: 0px -600px;
}

.ic_soption-up-correct {
	background-position: 0px -300px;
	cursor: default;
}

.ic_soption-down-correct {
	background-position: 0px -900px;
	cursor: default;
}

.ic_soption-up-wrong {
	background-position: 0px -300px;
	cursor: default;
}

.ic_soption-down-wrong {
	background-position: 0px -1200px;
	cursor: default;
}

.ic_soption-up-hovering {
	background-position: 0px -0px;
}

.ic_soption-down-hovering {
	background-position: 0px -600px;
}

/*MULTIPLE CHOICE*/.ic_moption {
	cursor: pointer;
	line-height: 19px;
	clip:rect(0px, 52px, 26px, 0px);
	overflow: hidden;

/*--- Image Viewer ---*/.Image_Viewer_Public_frame {
	cursor: pointer;
	background-color: #ffffff;
	padding: 2px;
	border: 1px solid #b0bdd2;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
	z-index: 0 !important;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

.Image_Viewer_Public_frame .image-viewer-label {
	padding: 5px;
	padding-right: 5px;
	padding-left: 5px;
	margin-right: 20px;
	border: solid 1px #656565;
	background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9);
	-webkit-box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	border-radius:6px;
	color: #000000;
	font-size: 14px;
	font-family: Verdana;
	text-align: center;
	background-position: center;
	line-height: 18px;
}

	/* FF3.6+ */		background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, color-stop(0%, #fefefe), color-stop(50%, #dbdbdb), color-stop(51%, #d1d1d1), color-stop(100%, #e2e2e2));
	/* Chrome,Safari4+ */		background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #fefefe 0%, #dbdbdb 50%, #d1d1d1 51%, #e2e2e2 100%);
	/* Chrome10+,Safari5.1+ */		background: -o-linear-gradient(top, #fefefe 0%, #dbdbdb 50%, #d1d1d1 51%, #e2e2e2 100%);
	/* Opera 11.10+ */		background: -ms-linear-gradient(top, #fefefe 0%, #dbdbdb 50%, #d1d1d1 51%, #e2e2e2 100%);
	/* IE10+ */		background: linear-gradient(top, #fefefe 0%, #dbdbdb 50%, #d1d1d1 51%, #e2e2e2 100%);
 /* W3C */		filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient( startColorstr='#fefefe', endColorstr='#e2e2e2', GradientType=0 );
/* IE6-9 */	}

/*--- animation ---*/.animationFrame {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
	padding: 2px;
	background-color: transparent;
}

.animationFrame .animation-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animationFrame .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

/*--- animation small---*/	.animationFrame-small {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
	padding: 2px;
	background-color: #ffffff;
}

.animationFrame-small .animation-watermark {
	display: block;
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animationFrame-small .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 40px;
	width: 40px;
	margin-top: -20px !important;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

/*--- animation empty---*/			.animation_empty {
	cursor: pointer;
	background-color: transparent;
	padding: 0 !important;
	border: 0 !important;
}

.animation_empty .animation-watermark {
	height: 100%;
	text-align: center;
	width: 100%;
}

.animation_empty .animation-watermark canvas {
	display: inline;
	height: 100px;
	width: 100px;
	margin-top: -50px;
	position: relative;
	top: 50%;
}

.animation-label {
	padding: 5px;
	padding-right: 5px;
	padding-left: 5px;
	border: solid 1px #656565;
	background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9);
	-webkit-box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	box-shadow:  1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
	border-radius:6px;
	color: #000000;
	font-size: 14px;
	font-family: Verdana;
	text-align: center;
	background-position: center;
}

/*-------------- standard button --------------*/.ic_button_standard {
	display: table;
	background-color:#f2f2f2;
	border: 1px solid #8e8e8e;
	border-radius: 4px;
	background-image: none;
	padding: 5px;
	text-align: center;
	color: #6B6B6B;
	/* background: #fafafa;
 */ /* Old browsers */	background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
	/* FF3.6+ */	background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, color-stop(20%, #fafafa), color-stop(45%, #dcdcdc), color-stop(51%, #c8c8c8), color-stop(90%, #f0f0f0));
	/* Chrome,Safari4+ */	background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
	/* Chrome10+,Safari5.1+ */	background: -o-linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
	/* Opera 11.10+ */	background: -ms-linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
	/* IE10+ */	background: linear-gradient(top, #fafafa 20%, #dcdcdc 45%, #c8c8c8 51%, #f0f0f0 90%);
 /* W3C */	filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient( startColorstr='#fafafa', endColorstr='#c8c8c8', GradientType=0 );
/* IE6-9 */}

.ic_button_standard div.html-face {
	display: table-cell;
	vertical-align: middle;
	height: auto !important;
}

.ic_button_standard-up-hovering {
	display: table;
	background-color:#8b8b8b;
	border: 1px solid #606060;
	border-radius: 4px;
	background-image: none;
	padding: 5px;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px 2px #000000;
	filter: dropshadow(color=#000000, offx=0, offy=1);
	text-align: center;
	color: #ffffff;
	background: #d9d9d9;
	/* Old browsers */	background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #d9d9d9 20%, #aaaaaa 45%, #a0a0a0 51%, #dcdcdc 90%);
	/* FF3.6+ */	background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, color-stop(20%, #d9d9d9), color-stop(45%, #aaaaaa), color-stop(51%, #a0a0a0), color-stop(90%, #dcdcdc));
	/* Chrome,Safari4+ */	background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #d9d9d9 20%, #aaaaaa 45%, #a0a0a0 51%, #dcdcdc 90%);
	/* Chrome10+,Safari5.1+ */	background: -o-linear-gradient(top, #d9d9d9 20%, #aaaaaa 45%, #a0a0a0 51%, #dcdcdc 90%);
	/* Opera 11.10+ */	background: -ms-linear-gradient(top, #d9d9d9 20%, #aaaaaa 45%, #a0a0a0 51%, #dcdcdc 90%);
	/* IE10+ */	background: linear-gradient(top, #d9d9d9 20%, #aaaaaa 45%, #a0a0a0 51%, #dcdcdc 90%);
 /* W3C */	filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.gradient( startColorstr='#d9d9d9', endColorstr='#a0a0a0', GradientType=0 );
/* IE6-9 */}

	display: table;
	background-color:#2956a3;
	border: 1px solid #06A4E2;
	border-radius: 4px;
	background-image: none;
	padding: 5px;
	text-align: center;
	color: #026387;

	/* Old browsers */	background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #ebf1f6 20%, #abd3ee 45%, #89c3eb 51%, #d5ebfb 90%);
	/* FF3.6+ */	background: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, color-stop(20%, #ebf1f6), color-stop(45%, #abd3ee), color-stop(51%, #89c3eb), color-stop(90%, #d5ebfb));

/* WRITING CALCULATIONS */	.WritingCalculations {
	background-color: #fafafa;
	border: 0;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding: 40px;
}

.WritingCalculations #writing-calculations-wrapper {
	margin: auto;
}

.WritingCalculations .container-line {
	border-bottom: 1px solid darkgrey !important;
}

.WritingCalculations .wrapper-row {
	margin: 3px 0 3px 0;
	background-color: none;
}

.WritingCalculations .wrapper-cell {
	font-size: 17px;
	color: #717171;
	font-family: Verdana;
	line-height:24px;
}

.WritingCalculations .writing-calculations-input {
	border: 1px solid #B0BDD2;
	border-radius: 5px;
	padding-left: 2px;
	display: block;
	font-size: 17px;
	height: 24px;
}

.WritingCalculations .correct {
	background-image: none;
	background-color: #44dd00 !important;
	color: #fff !important;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px 2px #000000;
	filter: dropshadow(color=#000000, offx=0, offy=1);
	padding-left: 2px !important;
}

.WritingCalculations .incorrect {
	background-image: none;
	background-color: red !important;
	color: #fff !important;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px 2px #000000;
	filter: dropshadow(color=#000000, offx=0, offy=1);
	padding-left: 2px !important;
}

.text_paragraph_calculations {
	font-size: 17px;
	color: #717171;
	font-family: Verdana;
	padding: 0;
	line-height: 24px;
}

.text_paragraph_calculations input {
	display: inline;
	font-size: 17px;
	height: 24px;
	width: 27px;
	padding: 0px;
	margin: 0 5px 0 5px;
	vertical-align: middle;
}

.text_paragraph_calculations input.ic_inlineChoice-correct {
	background-color: #44dd00 !important;
	color: #fff !important;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px 2px #000000;
	filter: dropshadow(color=#000000, offx=0, offy=1);
}

.text_paragraph_calculations input.ic_inlineChoice-wrong {
	background-color: red !important;
	color: #fff !important;
	text-shadow: 0px 1px 2px #000000;
	filter: dropshadow(color=#000000, offx=0, offy=1);
}

/*-------------- PLOT --------------*/.plotAddon {
	border: 1px solid #b0bdd2;
	padding: 10px;
	color: #717171;
}

.plotAddon .canvas {
	background: transparent !important;
}

.plotAddon .draw {
	stroke: #06A4E2;
}

.plotAddon .draw_over, .plotAddon .draw_1_over, .plotAddon .draw_2_over, .plotAddon .draw_3_over, .plotAddon .draw_4_over, .plotAddon .draw_5_over, .plotAddon .draw_6_over, .plotAddon .draw_7_over, .plotAddon .draw_8_over {
	stroke: #888888 !important;
}

.plotAddon .draw_selected, .plotAddon .draw_1_selected, .plotAddon .draw_2_selected, .plotAddon .draw_3_selected, .plotAddon .draw_4_selected, .plotAddon .draw_5_selected {
	stroke: #888888 !important;
}

.plotAddon .draw_1 {
	stroke: #06A4E2;
}

.plotAddon .draw_2 {
	stroke: #E862E2;
}

.plotAddon .draw_3 {
	stroke: #815DE2;
}

.plotAddon .draw_4 {
	stroke: #FFB600;
}

.plotAddon .draw_5 {
	stroke: #55E5D7;
}

.plotAddon .draw_6 {
	stroke: #BA4AB0;
